intro: Fenzlia, commonly known as the mountain holly, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Ericaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of Asia, particularly in countries like China, Japan, and Korea. The plants are shrubs characterized by their evergreen leaves and clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers. Fenzlia species often thrive in acidic, well-drained soils and are adapted to cool, moist environments. They are valued in horticulture for their ornamental value and ability to tolerate shade.
